Open source is breaking.

Maintainers are burning out. Spammers are flooding. Critical code is dying.

Imagine an ecosystem where contributing quality code pays you, and maintaining projects doesn't destroy you.

The Real Problem

You review 47 PRs this week. 43 are AI-generated garbage. You can't take it anymore.

You fix a critical bug for free. Nobody thanks you. Not economically, not with recognition.

Your stack depends on 200 libraries maintained by burned-out people. Massive risk.

How It Works

For Maintainers

  • Publish bounties for issues/features you need solved
  • The community validates PRs for you (reputation system)
  • Focus on architecture, not spam

For Contributors

  • Earn money solving real issues
  • Build verifiable on-chain reputation
  • Access premium projects with higher reputation

For Enterprises

  • Fund maintenance of your critical dependencies
  • Guarantee competent code review
  • Transparent audit trail of all contributions

Why Blockchain (But Don't Worry)

We use blockchain for 3 things that actually matter: 1. Payments without predatory fees 2. Reputation you can't delete or manipulate 3. Community governance without dictators You don't need to understand crypto to use this.

Anti-Gaming: Built-In Protections

  • ❌ You can't farm reputation with fake repos
  • ❌ You can't approve your own PRs
  • ❌ You can't spam AI garbage without losing money
  • ✅ Stake system + community validation + pattern detection

(Technical details shared with early access members)

Already Talking With

We're in conversations with maintainers of major OSS projects.

Maintain a project with 1000+ stars? We want to talk to you first.

Questions?

Doesn't this already exist?

Yes (Gitcoin, Tea, etc.), but we're doing it differently. We focus on real incentives, not hype. Quality first.

Why blockchain?

Only for what matters: cheap payments, immutable reputation, governance without gatekeepers. Everything else is boring tech.

When do you launch?

Q3 2025 if we validate 200+ quality early signups. We're not rushing.

How do you prevent another dead platform?

We don't launch until 20+ real projects are committed. Real commitments first, hype never.
